name: chart_1767399970220_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:26:10.220Z

name: chart_1767399970220_desired_outcome
observations: simexp utilizes Anemoi A2A communication patterns to enable real-time multi-session coordination and enhanced session forking with context inheritance, reducing reliance on file-based context transfer.

name: chart_1767399970220_current_reality
observations: simexp currently relies on file-based context handoffs (CONTEXT.md) and Redis/webhook events for multi-session coordination. There is no direct agent-to-agent communication channel. The simexp project is aware of the Anemoi protocol and its potential benefits, as detailed in the 2602011335-Anemoi-A3A-Communication-Pattern.md document.

name: chart_1767399970220_action_1
observations: Adopt Agent Continuations pattern for session state management (Phase 1).

name: chart_1767399970220_action_2
observations: Add Anemoi A2A MCP server for multi-session coordination (Phase 2).

name: chart_1767399970220_action_3
observations: Evaluate full semi-centralized redesign after validating Phase 1 and 2 (Phase 3).

name: chart_1767399970220_beat_1767400137519
observations: Act 1 Discovery/Learning
Universe: engineer-world, ceremony-world, story-engine-world

narrative.description: The initial research and recognition of Anemoi A2A communication patterns as a viable solution to address current limitations in simexp's session management and inter-agent communication. This beat focuses on understanding the technical capabilities and potential benefits.
narrative.prose: In the engineer-world, the Anemoi protocol emerged as a structured solution, promising to untangle the spaghetti of file-based context transfers and asynchronous Redis events. Its A2A communication offered a vision of cleaner, more efficient inter-agent dialogue. From the ceremony-world perspective, Anemoi's semi-centralized approach represented a shift from isolated agents to a more collaborative, thread-bound circle of communication, fostering a sense of shared presence rather than distant handoffs. In the story-engine-world, this discovery marked the inciting incident, revealing a path to a more integrated and fluid narrative flow between the disparate parts of simexp, a move towards a more cohesive agentic consciousness.
lessons: Understanding new protocols requires deep technical and comparative analysis.
Initial assessment of a new technology should include trade-off analysis.
The existing system's pain points provide clear drivers for adopting new solutions.

name: chart_1767400242366_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:30:42.366Z

name: chart_1767400242366_desired_outcome
observations: Implement a Searchable Inquiry Registry with NCP Storyform & Assumption Tracking for SimExp Sessions

name: chart_1767400242366_current_reality
observations: SimExp currently lacks a centralized system for tracking session genealogy, topics, and relationships beyond basic UUID tracking. The CONTENT.md document highlights the need for such a registry.

name: chart_1767400272748_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:31:12.748Z

name: chart_1767400272748_desired_outcome
observations: Formalize SimExp Session Forking with Agent Continuations and Robust Continuity Mechanisms

name: chart_1767400272748_current_reality
observations: SimExp's current session forking mechanism relies on file-based context transfer, which can lead to incomplete context inheritance. The Agent Continuations pattern offers a more robust solution for state capture and transfer.

name: chart_1767400290363_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:31:30.363Z

name: chart_1767400290363_desired_outcome
observations: Integrate NCP and Anemoi for Pre-Fork Continuity Validation in SimExp Sessions

name: chart_1767400290363_current_reality
observations: SimExp lacks a formal mechanism to verify context continuity during session forks. Integrating NCP intent and trace IDs can provide structured semantic guardrails for agent communication and state preservation.

name: chart_1767400304665_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:31:44.665Z

name: chart_1767400304665_desired_outcome
observations: Develop Trigger-Based Dynamic Workspace Generation for SimExp Inquiries

name: chart_1767400304665_current_reality
observations: SimExp sessions currently operate within a static workspace. Dynamic generation of .code-workspace files tailored to specific inquiries would enhance environment context and streamline development.

name: chart_1767400317289_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:31:57.289Z

name: chart_1767400317289_desired_outcome
observations: Implement an Assumption Log with Confidence Tracking in SimExp

name: chart_1767400317289_current_reality
observations: SimExp agents do not currently track assumptions or their confidence levels, leading to potential opaque decision-making. An assumption log would increase transparency and enable better post-hoc analysis.

name: chart_1767400363036_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:32:43.036Z

name: chart_1767400363036_desired_outcome
observations: Bridge iaip-mcp to coaia-narrative for SimExp via Pull-Based Patterns

name: chart_1767400363036_current_reality
observations: The iaip-mcp (Four Directions guidance) and coaia-narrative (structural tension validation) modules are not formally integrated within SimExp. A pull-based MCP pattern is proposed to connect them efficiently.

name: chart_1767401877855_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-01-03T00:57:57.855Z

name: chart_1767401877855_desired_outcome
observations: Process Perplexity's Anemoi A2A, IAIP-COAIA Integration Analysis for SimExp

name: chart_1767401877855_current_reality
observations: Received and read comprehensive analysis from Perplexity on Anemoi A2A communication, its academic foundations, use cases for local agents in a fork-and-continuity paradigm, and critical next questions for IAIP-COAIA bridging, including refined action steps for SimExp.
